summary: Apples are round, edible fruits from trees grown worldwide. They originated in Central Asia and have been cultivated for thousands of years. Apples hold religious and mythological importance in many cultures. Commercially, apple cultivars are propagated using grafting onto rootstocks to control growth and fruit production. With over 7,500 cultivars, apples come in various tastes and uses, such as eating raw or making cider. They are prone to diseases and pests, controlled by organic or non-organic methods. In 2010, scientists sequenced the apple genome to help with disease control and breeding.
title: Apple
